div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 469 Macedonia?, 1927-1928 (463, 632) Burial: c. 200-180 B.C. (T) Contents: 23+ AR Alexander III: 6 late post. tetradr. (Pella 1, Heracleia Bith. 1 ANS 1944.100.36044, Assus 2 ANS 1944.100.31396 ANS 1944.100.31399, Mytilene 1 ANS 1944.100.31448, Erythrae 1 ANS 1944.100.32130) Lysimachus: 1 late post. tetradr. (By- zantium ANS 1944.100.81480 ) Antigonus Gonatas: 16 tetradr. ANS 1967.152.209 ANS 1967.152.210 ANS 1944.100.13849 * Philip V: c. 5 tetradr. ANS 1967.152.211 Disposition: New York 9 or 10 (5 Alex- ander, Lysimachus, 3 Antigonus, 1 Philip V portrait type); Boston 1 ? (Brett 716 Naville July 2, 1929, 205) * Newell's record includes the Philip V coins as possibly part of the bd.
